data.title: D1 Colleges: A Complete List
data.meta_description: View the most up-to-date list of NCAA Division 1 Colleges by state for all major sports.
data.text:
Complete List of NCAA Division 1 Colleges

NCAA Division 1 (D1) schools are the best colleges for sports. Today, there are 365 D1 schools across 49 states in the U.S. These schools have more student-athletes and bigger athletic budgets than D2 and D3 colleges. They also offer some of the best scholarships for your student-athlete.

Players in D1 schools are competitive when it comes to scholarship money. They also go head-to-head with the most talented college athletes in the country. Is your student-athlete thinking about playing for a D1 college? They might need to consider several schools because of how competitive they are.

D1 colleges and scholarships

Sports scholarships are typically available at NCAA D1 schools with large athletic programs. Keep in mind that not all D1 programs offer scholarship money, though. Itâ€™s also important to remember that D1 coaches award scholarship money to players. This means your student-athlete should contact coaches at their favorite schools early and often.

Find out more about athletic scholarships at D1 colleges.

NCAA D1 school recruiting and eligibility rules

D1 sports are the most regulated by the NCAA. This includes regulations for D1 football teams, D1 basketball teams, and D1 baseball teams.

The NCAA has strict rules for the D1 recruiting process. These rules limit when and how often a D1 coach can reach out to potential players. But your student-athlete can talk with coaches as early and as much as they want if they contact a coach first.

The NCAA must also declare your D1 athlete eligible through the NCAA Eligibility Center. Learn more about D1 NCAA eligibility requirements for your student-athlete.

Best D1 schools

Unsure which D1 school is the best fit for your student-athlete? NCSA Power Rankings took an in-depth look at more than 300 NCAA D1 schools to help you narrow down the best D1 schools for student-athletes across the country.
